alert.note: Alert for Adams; Gem; Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 7:05PM MDT until August 18 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Four Corners Fire burn scar in... Southeastern Adams County in southwestern Idaho... Northeastern Gem County in southwestern Idaho... West Central Valley County in southwestern Idaho... * Until 1000 PM MDT. * At 705 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Four Corners Fire Burn Scar. Between 0.2 and 0.4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 20 minutes. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.8 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving out of the burn area. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Four Corners Fire Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Four Corners Fire Burn Scar. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 20 MINUTES
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Four Corners Fire Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
